comments:
Rename goes through local rename OK which is there to help performance.
However there is some edit part activity afterwards.  To see subclass JPanel 
and drop a JLabel.  Rename the JLabel and the source is OK then after 1/2 a 
second on both the tree and GUI the JLabel moves off the panel onto the free 
form and then back again.  There is edit part deactivation, and a user got the 
following stack trace:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 0 set 29, 2004 08:58:18.328
!MESSAGE java.lang.NullPointerException
!STACK 0
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at
org.eclipse.ve.internal.swt.ControlGraphicalEditPart.activate
(ControlGraphicalEditPart.java:106)
	at
org.eclipse.gef.editparts.AbstractEditPart.addChild(AbstractEditPart.java:199)
	at
org.eclipse.gef.editparts.AbstractEditPart.refreshChildren
(AbstractEditPart.java:750)
	at
org.eclipse.ve.internal.swt.CompositeGraphicalEditPart.access$0
(CompositeGraphicalEditPart.java:1)
	at
org.eclipse.ve.internal.swt.CompositeGraphicalEditPart$1.run
(CompositeGraphicalEditPart.java:115)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.RunnableLock.run(RunnableLock.java:35)
	at
org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Synchronizer.runAsyncMessages(Synchronizer.java:106)

Does that mean that a child edit part failed to activate?  If you think we need
to fixe it in the next major fix pack (1.0.2), raise the severity to major, and
priority to P1.
